Reviews.Title: “dont like the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth W
Reviews.Content: yea the hotel was cheap and the office people were great but when me and my father went to bed i lied down and under the blankets there was a broken piece of a crack pipe so we get moved into a better room and when we went in it was cleaner but then we looked under our bed there was a pile of cigarette butts under there and now we havnt had hot water for two nights all i have to say dont stay here go across the street to the La Quinta i hear its better and the rooms are always clean yea it a lil more money but well worth it

Reviews.Title: “The Bates Motel would be better.”
Reviews.Author: Jerry E
Reviews.Content: OMG.. just think the Bates Motel would be off to stay than this [--] hole. We had this hotel booked for superbowl as a back up. I went to this hotel to see if we still had the room so that I could give it to someone on Sunday night and I walked in to the room and it smelled like death. The smoke smell was so bad you could cut it with a knife.... read the other reviews to confirm.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Coffeebuff
Reviews.Content: You might as well sleep in your car if you are going to stoop to a Red Roof Inn. We spent 3 nights during the Super Bowl, only because there were no rooms left in the city that we could find. The room was sprayed so heavily with disinfectant that it choked us upon entering. The walls had been bashed in and shoddily repaired, the carpet was filthy, and the night long noise from h**k**s doing business with people in various rooms was disgusting. NEVER will we use a Red Roof Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL IN ALL OF INDIANAPOLIS BE WARE”
Reviews.Author: CESARM M
Reviews.Content: THE worst stay ever the carpets are awful full of urine from cats and dog shows , as well AS the linen for the beds and towels .they dont let people know this checking in , then after wards they say oh im sorry like they hadno idea of what kind of events are going on in there hotel .this is a very serious problem considering people with allergies. donot stay here unless you want to get very sick or stay in blood stained sheets

Reviews.Title: “Needs a make-over”
Reviews.Author: grainbowjudy
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in other Red Roofs, even another in northern Indianapolis, this one is in need of a make-over. We stayed in a double room which was small and the bathroom was really small. Fan in bathroom was very loud. Other Red Roofs we stayed in had a flat screen TV and frig. This did not. As far as I know, this is the closest one to the downtown area, and you'd think they would try harder. It is just an older property and you can see the wear and tear it has gone through. Bed was also uncomfortable. This motel is more similar to a Motel 8 than other Red Roof's I have stayed in. Staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful people reasonable prices and clean”
Reviews.Author: Laudelino l
Reviews.Content: enjoying my stay have been staying here for 4 weeks consecutive and the staff is very friendly if i have any thing wrong they are always helpful in fixing it or solving the problem just a wonderful place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Stay here all the time”
Reviews.Author: Larry M
Reviews.Content: Curved shower rods would be most helpful Desk personnel are always top notch and very helpful

Reviews.Title: “absolutely loved my stay with them”
Reviews.Author: lucianooliveira_11
Reviews.Content: i have been staying now in this hotel for almost 4 weeks and absolutely would stay here again the wi fi and the staff is what makes it a great place everyone is so friendly and helpful they go out of the way to make the stay more enjoyable especially the young lady who works evenings she is wonderful!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Red Roof Experience Ever"”
Reviews.Author: bmjbmj
Reviews.Content: I stay at a lot of Red Roofs and this one was the worst, not because of the facilities, but because of the thoughtless management. Management thought it would be okay to check in an entire football team at 2:30 in the morning. For 15 minutes at least the team proceeded to drink and yell and throw the ball around in the parking lot. I called the front desk to complain and they said they would "look into it," but nothing was done. Instead of calling the cops, I thought I'd write this review. Dear Red Roof Management : Fire your night desk clerk of July 17, 2011, and save your reputation!

Reviews.Title: “Very Low End Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Duffnduff
Reviews.Content: The first room we were put into smelled like dirty wet dog! The toilet didn't even flush. They moved us to another room that still smelled but not as bad. We were so exhausted after a 14 hour drive and just wanted to rest. WIFI did not work, Wallpaper was peeling from walls, There were only about 15-20 TV Channels to watch, The mattresses were very hard and stiff, floors felt wet (kept shoes on) We will NOT be returning to any Red Roof Inn. The front desk clerk did give us a $10 discount for all the problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: dragracingfan
Reviews.Content: I attended the U.S. Nationals at O'reilly Raceway Park from 9/1 - 9/6, and I stayed at this Red Roof Inn for 6 nights from 8/31 - 9/5. The staff was friendly and courteous, my room was spotlessly clean and everything in it worked as it should. This Inn is within walking distance of Exit 52 off of I-465, and there are many, many restaurants and shopping centers, including a Walmart Supercenter, within walking distance right around the corner on Emerson Ave. Last, but certainly not least, was the price; I paid $34.99 per night for all 6 nights. In summation, I liked everything about this Red Roof Inn, and I found absolutely nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay at a Red Roof Inn”
Reviews.Author: neo1983
Reviews.Content: They gave us a "smoking room" when reserved a non-smoking room. AC unit was old and did not work. Called front desk to be moved to a new room and the second room was slightly better. Room was a non-smoking room. AC did work but AC unit was old and took awhile for room to get cold. AC units need to get updated. We usually stay at Red Roof Inn and this was the by far the cheapest looking Red Roof Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: BSUBigboy
Reviews.Content: Good location , right off I-465, several restaurants very nearby. There was a bit of a mix-up with the registration, but the clerk was very helpful in getting things in order. Room was adequate, clean, but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “S”
Reviews.Author: pegimac
Reviews.Content: We appreciate the friendliness of the staff. Our room was comfortable and clean, and we found restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Road Trip Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: Christa10
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this location while passing through Indianapolis on road trips. It's in a great location (for a road trip) off the 465 / 74 and close to restaurants. If I were visiting Indianapolis, I would probably choose a location closer to downtown. We stay at Red Roofs all over the US. Their pet friendly policy is a plus. As is the 24 hour coffee in the lobby. This Red Roofs is not one of the nicer ones. The room was large, clean, comfortable and a good value, but it was worn down and smelled musty. For the couple dollars extra, we took the Superior King and got a fridge and microwave. All of the rooms now have free WiFi. If you're travelling with a dog, you'll be glad to know that there is grass around back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rush426
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Red Roof Inn, Indianapolis South, (Beech Grove) since 1977. The hotel is right off of 465, exit Emerson Avenue. Great location, easy interstate access. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance, along with retail shopping close by. Only 10-15 minutes from downtown Indianapolis, without the high prices of the downtown hotels. It has not had the major rehab like some of the Roofs, but is clean and in good shape. All the people who work here, from the manager, desk clerks, maids, and maintanence man are always friendly and most helpful. As I said, been coming here since 1977 and never had a bad stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: DalShowDog
Reviews.Content: Red Roof South is an easy to get to location with clean, inviting rooms. We are exhibitors at the Indy Winter Classic Dog Show held at the fair grounds. The room provided ample space for our crate and supplies with a big, comfy king bed for us. I'd make Red Roof my preferred destination for dependable safe and clean lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff - Clean Room - Pet Friendly”
Reviews.Author: mtstate
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, even if the furnishings were a little shabby, and the staff was very friendly. This is NOT one of the remodeled hotels in the chain. The bed was comfortable and maid service came in to make the beds and deliver fresh towels every day. The walls are a little thin, thankfully I had quiet guests surrounding me. There are several fast food restaurants located nearby and a nice Japanese restaurant nextdoor. There is a Wal Mart across the street, which was a plus. I was traveling with a pet and I found the hotel to be very adequate. The only rooms offering free internet were the all inclusive Kings, so I had to pay $7.95 per day for wi-fi access, but I was told that very soon wi-fi service will be free to all guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for you and your pets!”
Reviews.Author: slvrcrst
Reviews.Content: I often stay at Red Roof hotels because they always accept pets, and they are a great value for the money. This Red Roof is in a very convenient location to both the interstate and restaurants, and, it was clean, quiet and the staff was excellent. While I did not in this case make a reservation, the staff quickly found a place for me to stay that was ideal for my needs. My cat, my 15 year old son and I had a restful night.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the cost”
Reviews.Author: yukon42
Reviews.Content: Rooms clean, did have internent access, small table to use for reading writing, beds comfortable, basic needs met, liked the room access direct instead of through lobby. Did have flavored coffees in the check-in area that were nice. Ice maching worked.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for FFA Convention”
Reviews.Author: sheilashee
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and I loved being able to park right at our front door. Coffee available in the lobby was great. We had a King single room and it was a little small. I'll take small, clean and a good value any day. The staff was very nice. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Freeeeeeeeeee”
Reviews.Author: California_Wine
Reviews.Content: I love "park at your door" motels when traveling across country. This one had plenty of parking, but like most motels you can't pull in at 10pm and expect to park where you can see your car out the window. Get there by 8pm and you'll be good. Hotel website had the best rate. This hotel was clean, and had free coffee in the lobby in the morning. The bad: I had to move the bed over a bit as the ceiling in the room sprung a tiny leak from something upstairs. I had already moved everything from my car to the room and didn't want to move. They did offer to relocate me, but I stayed because it was only one night and the leak wasn't bad. They comped my room in the morning...but I had to really haggle with them. During checkout some idiot waiting behind me in the tiny lobby took off running because someone drove off in his car outside. I can't speak for the neigborhood because I don't live there. Personally I had no problems, and did walk to the convenience store in the middle of the night for a snack w/o any issues. For the money (FREE), it was all good.

Reviews.Title: “Indy 500 again”
Reviews.Author: mkprice
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 business king rooms for the Indy 500 weekend. The rooms were about $40 less than anything we could find for the same time period. There was no continental breakfast of any sort, but we figured for $40/day we could eat a pretty good breakfast somewhere else. Positives: Clean room, nice staff, cheaper than other hotels, outside room entrance and lots of parking, good location for getting around the city. Not so positives: Website says that business kings have a microwave and refrigerator. One of our rooms did, the other 2 didn't. I asked at the desk and she said that they only had 2 rooms that had that feature. No closet and not much drawer space (2 large drawers only). Toilet didn't have a seat lid. It wasn't that big a deal, I just like to put the lid down after I use it. No iron or hair dryer (not a big deal to me, but the others in my group weren't prepared). Overall I would recommend this hotel, especially if you aren't planning on spending much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out - phones not labelled right”
Reviews.Author: car_bound_canuck
Reviews.Content: Clean, decent rooms, lots of amenities in the area. But watch out for the room phones! The one in my room apparently was borrowed from Kentucky, so when I gave the number to my family so they could call me back, they kept getting the wrong hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Red Roof Inn Indianapolis - South
HotelInfo.Address: 5221 Victory Dr., Indianapolis, IN 46203
